September 13, 2006 Encoded in XMetal 2 by Amelia Abreu
TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Letter from artist and writer Paul Alexander Bartlett, written from Tucson, Arizona to Chicago philanthropist Anita McCormick Blaine. June 11, 1933. Request for support in writing education.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Artist and author (1909-1990). Graduate of Oberlin College, he taught at Georgia State College (1955) and served as editor of publications at the University of California Santa Barbara (1964-70). Published books include the photographic work, The Haciendas of Mexico: an artist's record , and the novels, Adios, mi MÃ©xico, and When the Owl Cries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from artist and writer Paul Alexander Bartlett, written from Tucson, Arizona to Chicago philanthropist Anita McCormick Blaine. June 11, 1933.

A collection of Bartlett's photographs and drawings is held at the Benson Latin American Collection at University of Texas-Austin.: Paul A. Bartlett Drawings and Photographs of Mexican Haciendas, 1940-1973, Benson Latin American Collection, General Libraries, University of Texas at Austin. (https://txarchives.org/utlac/finding_aids/00006.xml)
A collection of Bartlett's literary papers is held at the Young Library, University of California, Los Angeles:

Paul Alexander Bartlett Papers (Collection 2106). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles. (http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/ft596nb0gx)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Paul Alexander Bartlett Letter, Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form.
